text: Fit a wire rack over a baking pan. (Something other than the counter to catch the drips). Set it aside for now. Fill a saucepan with 1 inch (2.5 cm) of water and bring it to a boil.  Reduce the heat to medium.  Mix the ingredients together in a metal bowl and place into the saucepan.  Stir occasionally until just blended.  Remove the bowl from the heat.  Dip each cookie by the corner (corner being relative as most cookies are round). This will get as much, or as little, of the cookie dipped as you want. Set on the rack that you prepared earlier. Allow them to cool. Do this until you run out of cookies or chocolate.  Finished.
